AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: Support (with apparent AI-assisted content) provided an incorrect root-cause conclusion (license bound to old hardware/Proxmox incompatibility) and routed the customer to Customer Care, but later internal notes confirmed this was a known/expected AppManager agent reset issue after config restore. Early ATLAS chat was also generic and did not engage the specific license/AppManager error.
evidence: ATLAS: "Please select from the below or give me a detailed description of what’s happening. Any error messages you’ve seen or steps you’ve already tried would be really helpful."

Mike (public): "The Root Cause: The license file information is incorrect or incompatible with your new Proxmox virtual environment... the license file is still bound to the old hardware box's serial number"
Private note (later): "The issue is misclassification of tickets where the error message ... is mistakenly treated as a license issue."
Private note (later): "Resolution: Reset the AppManager agent — this is the only valid fix."

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: The customer repeatedly indicated the issue persisted after following instructions and providing screenshots/logs, and support continued to request additional artifacts/steps, contributing to a loop before the correct fix was identified.
evidence: Customer: "customer care send me to Atlas! please make from conversation support request for technician"
Customer: "The problem still persist. ... I sent you screenshots with log."
Customer: "Hello,do you have some solution for me?"
Support: "If the registration still fails... please download the Support Information File... and attach it to this ticket."
Customer: "problem still persist. I sent you log file."
Support (again): "If the issue persists, please download a new Support Information File ... and attach it to this ticket for further review."

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: Support did not fully incorporate customer-provided context (already sent screenshots/logs and confirmed connectivity tests) and continued with repeated requests and an incorrect diagnosis, despite evidence that the license file was valid and outbound access was working.
evidence: Customer: "I sent you screenshots with log."
Customer: "problem still persist. I sent you log file."
Customer: "Hello, without change... 1. test DNS, ok ... 3. outbond access is ok, also from ssh terminal, lynx, curl.. open website appmanager.gfi.com ok"
Support (after customer confirmed connectivity): "The issue is clearly with the license registration itself... license file is still bound to the old hardware box's serial number"
Private note (later contradicting earlier handling): "misclassification... mistakenly treated as a license issue."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: The customer had to follow up for lack of response, indicating a service delay. There is also a ~2-day gap between the customer's 2025-10-21 update and the next public support reply on 2025-10-23.
evidence: Customer (2025-10-22T18:41:38+00:00): "Hello,do you have some solution for me?"
Customer (2025-10-21T05:34:22+00:00): "The problem still persist..."
Support next response (2025-10-23T11:51:44+00:00): "Dear Milos, Thank you for your update..."

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: The ticket was not shown as closed before resolution; the customer confirmed the problem was solved and thanked support. The auto-close warning text is present, but no actual premature closure occurred in the provided timeline.
evidence: Customer: "Hi, your colleague solve this problem... Thank you"
Support: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\"..."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The case was tagged as a core functionality defect and described as 'Limited services', yet it was handled with standard steps and misrouted to Customer Care based on an incorrect license conclusion instead of prompt escalation/recognition of a known post-restore AppManager agent issue.
evidence: System escalation note: "The severity is: core_functionality_defect"
System escalation note: "The customer message is:Limited services"
Support (misroute): "The customer will need to contact GFI Customer Care for further assistance."
Private note (later indicating known/expected behavior): "This behavior is expected and happens in 100% of such cases. Resolution: Reset the AppManager agent — this is the only valid fix."
